result.execSummary:
The defendant Glenn Lenell Sharp Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $227.77, payable to the victim, McDonald's, located at 5739 W. Silver Spring Dr., Milwaukee, WI.  Restitution is to be paid over the period of Probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay all applicable Court costs, fees and surcharges (DNA surcharge) over the period of Probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
As a convicted felon, defendant may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Defendant's voting rights are suspended until his civil rights are restored.
NO CONTACT withthe victims: Mcdonald's located at 5191 N Teutonia Ave., Milwaukee, WI and McDonald's located at 5739 W. Silver Spring Dr., Milwaukee, WI.

Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.   
Comply with standard rules of Probation.

Participate in & cooperate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY;  submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time.  Court ordered Good Time credit for the condition time

Corrected JOC reflects 6 days of sentence credit not shown on original JOC

Defendant Glenn Lenell Sharp in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 6 days time served.
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 8 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" - STRAIGHT time.  Court ordered good time credit for the condition time.
* No contact with the victims, McDonald's located at 5191 N. Teutonia Avenue, Milwaukee, WI and McDonald's located at 5739 W. Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI.
* Seek and maintain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $227.00 to the victim, McDonald's located at 5739 W. Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Glenn Lenell Sharp in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. 

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 06-18-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
